Package foodhub.controllers

Class FirmController

java.lang.Object
foodhub.controllers.FirmController
@RestController public class FirmController extends Object
The controller for all Firm backend methods. All permissions that a Firm has are held within this class.

  • Constructor Details

    • FirmController

      public FirmController()

  • Method Details

    • authenticateFirm

      @PostMapping("/firms-authenticate") public Message authenticateFirm​(@RequestBody Authentication body)
      Authenticates a Firm using its login credentials. This method always returns a Message, either stating the success of authorization or a failure with an error explaining why it failed. Errors include wrong username and wrong password.
      Parameters:
      body - an Authentication entity, with Firm login details
      Returns:
      a Message describing method status (success/failure with error)
      See Also:
      Authentication

    • createCategory

      @PostMapping("/firms-create-category") public Message createCategory​(@RequestBody AddCategoryInput body)
      Allows a Firm to create a Category to add to their menu. This method always returns a Message describing the status of itself, either a success following a successful addition of a category, or a failure with an error explaining why it failed. Errors include wrong username, wrong password, or no category data given (null).
      Parameters:
      body - an AddCategoryInput, which includes Firm login details and Category details
      Returns:
      a Message describing the status of the method (success/failure with error)
      See Also:
      AddCategoryInput

    • editCategory

      @PostMapping("/firms-edit-category") public Message editCategory​(@RequestBody EditCategoryInput body)
      Allows a Firm to edit the information related to a Category on its menu. This method always returns a message about the status of iteslf, either a success on successful running or a failure with an error explaining why it failed. Errors include wrong username, wrong password, the new category information not being supplied (null), or the category selected to be edited not existing.
      Parameters:
      body - an EditCategoryInput entity, which includes Firm login details and the Category selected to be edited.
      Returns:
      a Message detailing the status of the method (success/failure with error)
      See Also:
      EditCategoryInput

    • removeCateogry

      @PostMapping("/firms-remove-category") public Message removeCateogry​(@RequestBody RemoveEntity body)
      Allows a Firm to remove a Category from its menu. This method always returns a message about its own status, either a success on successfully removing the category, or a failure with an error explaining why the method failed. Errors include wrong username, wrong password, or the selected category not existing (null).
      Parameters:
      body - a RemoveEntity entity, which includes Firm login details and the Category to be deleted
      Returns:
      a Message describing the status of the removal (success/failure with error)
      See Also:
      RemoveEntity

    • createItem

      @PostMapping("/firms-create-item") public Message createItem​(@RequestBody AddItemInput body)
      Allows a Firm to create an Item to add to their menu. This method always returns a Message describing the status of itself, either a success following a successful addition of a item, or a failure with an error explaining why it failed. Errors include wrong username, wrong password, no item data given (null), or the specified category not existing (null).
      Parameters:
      body - an AddItemInput, which includes Firm login details and Item details.
      Returns:
      a Message describing the status of the method (success/failure with error)
      See Also:
      AddItemInput

    • editItem

      @PostMapping("/firms-edit-item") public Message editItem​(@RequestBody EditItemInput body)
      Allows a Firm to edit the information related to a Item on its menu. This method always returns a message about the status of itself, either a success on successful running or a failure with an error explaining why it failed. Errors include wrong username, wrong password, the new Item information not being supplied (null), or the Item selected to be edited not existing.
      Parameters:
      body - an EditItemInput entity, which includes Firm login details and the Item selected to be edited.
      Returns:
      a Message detailing the status of the method (success/failure with error)
      See Also:
      EditItemInput

    • removeItem

      @PostMapping("/firms-remove-item") public Message removeItem​(@RequestBody RemoveEntity body)
      Allows a Firm to remove an Item from its menu. This method always returns a message about its own status, either a success on successfully removing the item, or a failure with an error explaining why the method failed. Errors include wrong username, wrong password, or the selected item not existing (null).
      Parameters:
      body - a RemoveEntity entity, which includes Firm login details and the Item to be deleted
      Returns:
      a Message describing the status of the removal (success/failure with error)
      See Also:
      RemoveEntity

    • getOrders

      @PostMapping("/firms-get-orders") public List<OrderOutput> getOrders​(@RequestBody Authentication body)
      Lets Firms see all the incoming Orders from Customers. This method always returns a List, including ones that may be empty. Empty order lists are given in the case of a wrong username, wrong password, or no orders currently being made to the Firm.
      Parameters:
      body - an Authentication entity for login information for a Firm
      Returns:
      a List of all orders connected to the authenticated firm.
      See Also:
      Authentication

    • completeOrder

      @PostMapping("/firms-complete-order") public Message completeOrder​(@RequestBody CompleteOrderInput body)
      Allows a Firm to set the status of an Order as complete
      Parameters:
      body - a CompleteOrderInput, which includes Firm login details and order details
      Returns:
      a Message stating the status of completion (success/failure with error)
      See Also:
      CompleteOrderInput
